item.title: Jad problem
item.dc:creator: @kickingjamie kickingjamie
item.description:
@kickingjamie wrote:

Well… I’d suggest checking if your server even has grahams event manager because that code is for grahams event manager. If your server doesn’t have it then you should find look in process() and see how timeing is done in there or something.

item.title: Jad problem
item.dc:creator: @kickingjamie kickingjamie
item.description:
@kickingjamie wrote:

public void spawnJad() { EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() { public void execute(EventContainer e) { Server.fightCaves.spawnNextWave((Client) PlayerHandler.players[playerId]); e.stop(); } }, 10000); }
That will fix the last one. The top 2 are because you don’t have an event manager class I guess…

Read full topic

item.description:
@Chaotic-Madness wrote:

I have tried to add jad but i get this

[size=18pt]Code[/size]

[code]	public void SpawnJad() {
 EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() {
      public void execute(EventContainer e) {
           Server.fightCaves.spawnNextWave((Client) PlayerHandler.players[playerId]);
           e.stop();
      }
}, 10000);

}[/code]
